sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: Russia claims it foiled a Ukrainian drone attack against the Kremlin overnight and released pictures of Vladimir Putin in meetings today to show the attack failed.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: Russian rockets killed 21 people in Kherson, many of them in a hypermarket and a railway station.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: Shells also destroyed homes in Zaporizhia.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: A teenage boy is under arrest after allegedly opening fire at a primary school in Belgrade early Wednesday morning, killing nine and injuring seven.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: Russian President Vladimir Putin has been shown safe and sound after the alleged drone attack on the Kremlin overnight.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: Moscow accuses Kiev of trying to kill Putin in an attack allegedly captured by these images spread via Twitter and reproduced by some international media.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: In a statement, the Russian government says Putin was not in the Kremlin and that it will respond as and when it deems necessary.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: Spokesman Dmitry Peskov said the Kremlin would follow security advice as far as drones are concerned for the May 9 victory parade.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: Ukrainians denied having anything to do with what happened.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: Presidential adviser Mikhailo Podolyak sees behind this alleged attack a plan to justify future terrorist actions or attacks against civilians in Ukraine.

A hypermarket in Kherson hit by Russian shelling.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: At least 21 people died in the town, another 48 were injured.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: Also caught up in the shelling, employees of an energy company drafted in to repair power grids damaged in previous Russian strikes.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: A railway station was also hit by the Russian shells and residents were warned to stay indoors.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Homes were destroyed by Russian shells in Zaporizhia, one of 10 regions hit, 146 settlements targeted in all.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: Over the border, a drone drop caused a fire at a Russian oil depot in the village of Volna, Krasnodar Krai, a day before a locomotive and several freight cars were derailed by an explosion in the Bryansk region.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: A teenager who allegedly shot dead eight fellow students and a school guard in Belgrade has been detained.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: Police say a boy, called Kostya Kekmanovich, burst into a classroom and opened fire using his father's gun.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: Six other pupils and a teacher were wounded in the attack. A senior official said the boy himself called police after the shooting.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: Euronews Serbia's Bojan Berkic says investigators are still trying to establish a motive.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: The citizens of Serbia are expressing their shock on social networks after the news they heard this morning and are trying to comprehend just what happened because despite the fact that the Serbian nation is among the most armed in the world, school shootings have never happened before in Serbian history.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: And everyone is trying to get an answer to a simple question, what prompted a 14-year-old child from a primary school with exemplary behavior and prize-winning record to walk into a classroom and shoot his classmates and teachers.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Now, there is no answer to this question.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: There have been some claims on social networks that bullying was the trigger, but we will not know until the investigation is over.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Bojan Brkic, Euronews, Serbia, from Belgrade.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: I'm Bojan Berkic, Euronews Serbia from Belgrade.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_10

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: The European Commission is proposing a series of new measures to combat corruption in the EU but also worldwide.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: With the new directive, the EU wants to harmonize the definition of criminal offenses such as influence peddling and abuse of office.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: And it would require member states to impose more criminal sanctions in corruption cases.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: The package will raise the bar in the sense of EU-wide definitions and penalties of corruption crimes and will help authorities to catch and punish the criminals, be it from public or private sector, no matter where they happen.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: from public or private sector, no matter where they happen. We see a lot of differences between national definitions of corruption, too big, and also the penalties attached to them.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: This makes also cross-border investigations more difficult and creates loopholes that are used by criminals.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: One element of the proposal is to combat corruption outside Europe. The package would enable the EU to introduce entry bans and acid freezes for individuals and entities from third countries if they have committed serious corruption offenses. Last December former assistants to EU parliamentarians and NGOs were arrested in the biggest corruption scandal in EU history.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Anti-corruption NGO Transparency International warned that the EU must first put its own house in order before targeting foreign corruption suspects.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: The European Union has serious problems with corruption. We have seen that in Qatar, and many other examples, and also certain member states have very serious problems.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: So of course it's very important that we cannot do anything abroad if we have this kind of impunity for EU nationals at home.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: So this is very important to make sure that the EU also steps up their domestic work in that regard.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: According to the Commission, corruption costs the EU economy around 120 billion euros every year and undermines confidence in democracy. The European Commission plans to allocate more than 500 million euros to increase ammunition

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: production to help Ukraine and replenish the stocks of EU member states. With its Act in Support of Ammunition Production, ASAP, unveiled on Wednesday, the Commission will fund industry measures to boost ammunition production, such as components, machines and workforce.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_11
sentences.sentence: Brussels will also allow EU countries to redirect cohesion and stimulus funds to their defence industries. des fonds de stimulus à travers les industries de défense. and some say the same for the European defence industry.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_11
sentences.sentence: How do we get to a mode of war economy?

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Globally, they Kiev is asking for.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_11
sentences.sentence: It's a start, but it's unlikely to be enough.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: The amounts of ammunition being consumed in this war are huge.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: Ukraine fires more artillery rounds in a couple of weeks than the British or French armies have in their entire stockpiles.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: So it's not just about keeping Ukraine in the fight, it's also about replenishing our stockpiles and giving us the capacity to be able to fight high intensity war again. So we need to increase our capacity and increase our stockpiles beyond what they were even two years ago. Brussels says the money would be up to 60% of co-funding for specific projects and member states or companies would have to come up with the rest of the money.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: But should the EU aim for a made-in-Europe project?

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: I think we need to see ourselves as part of the Western alliance, and that includes not only the United States and the United Kingdom of Canada, but also South Korea and Japan.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: South Korea, for example, has started building tanks for Poland, partly because it has the scale of manufacture that European companies don't currently have, but it's also a market for us. In the end, these are all advanced democratic countries with generally aligned foreign policies, so it's secure to be able to have the defence industry relationships with Seoul or with Tokyo, just as much as it is with the United States.

sentences.sentence: This is a one-year plan to be completed by June 2025 and will primarily benefit 11 member states that have the capacity to produce these 155-millimeter artillery shells.
